$model = Model_User::find($id);
 echo (string) $model; // returns SELECT * FROM ...

 var_dump((array)$model);

array(

)

docblock.description: find record in database table by condition
docblock.long-description:
//if we need to find by primary key
 $model = Model_User::find($some_value);
 // complex condition
 $model = Model_User::find(array(
   'login' => 'bla',
   ....
 ));
 //get values
 echo $model->login;// output 'bla'

if row was not found Exception will be called

docblock.description: find a collections of rows in database table
docblock.long-description:
// complex condition only
 $model = Model_User::find_all(array(
   'login' => 'bla',
   ....
));

to get records

 $records = $model->records;

each item in array it's a object of certain module so you can do everything. e.g. delete

foreach($model->records as $_model)
{
 $_model->destroy();//can be everything from Base_Model
}

docblock.description: returns array with table columns SQL query
execute commands wich get as array e.g.
docblock.long-description:
$m = Model_User::find_all(array(
   'limit' => 2, //will set limit
));
  • limit - sets limit for query
  • offset - sets offset for query
  • total_count - sets to execute another one query to count all records in table with the same conditions from previous query ignoring limit and offset. Result of this query will be set to $count variable of this class

docblock.description: Helper function to create WHERE clause
docblock.long-description:
what for to rewrite?

  • this function build more safe where condition for queries
  • any field that are not describe in table ( see table_columns()) will be ignored
  • each type for field will be cleaned and convert to their type in database
  • do not required setting values for fileds if you already have them in object. Just tell what field you need

can be changed in future, because supports only

  • = comparison key ( WHERE `field` = `value`)
  • IN ( WHERE `field` IN (...))
  • DB expression ->e.g. WHERE `field` REGEXPR "..."

filter options sets throw array assoc or not e.g. of not assoc array

  array('login', 'email');

in that case values will be get from current model object if they exists e.g. of assoc array

  array(
      'login' => 'bla',
      'email' => 'email@site.com',
 );

Also values of fields can be array . In this case comparison key will be IN Also supports DB::expr as value

docblock.description: set parameters for SELECT query

tag.name: param
tag.description:
can be
  • string - e.g. '*'
  • single array - e.g. array('id','user_id') first field name, second his alias name in sql -> `id` AS `user_id`
  • multidementional array - e.g. array( array('id','user_id'), array('login','user_login')...)

docblock.description: sets parameters for INSERT query
docblock.long-description:
$fields can be sets as array e.g. of not assoc array

  array('login', 'email');

if you call function save() all values for fields will be automatical get from object if they exists

docblock.description: sets parameters for UPDATE query
creates DELETE query object
docblock.long-description:
if $filter not specified will search by primary key usage example

$model->destroy() // if we already have object
//or
Model_User::destroy($id);
//or
Model_User::destroy(array('login' => 'bla', ....));

checks values of fields and convert to type of field

docblock.long-description:
$additional_rules = array(
     'pswd_confirmation' => array(
       'not_empty',
       array('equals', array($this->pswd_confirmation, $this->password, 'password'))
    ),
  );
  $this->validate($additional_rules);//check according rules

Creating rules simmilar to Kohana's Validation Also if some model has function rules() before saving data it will get from that function and validate data

docblock.description: Replaces Kohana's `Kohana::exception_handler()` method.
docblock.long-description: This does the same thing, but also adds email functionality and the ability to perform an action in response to the exception. These actions and emails are customizable per type in the config file for this module.

docblock.description: Replace Kohana's `Kohana::shutdown_handler()` method with one that will use our error handler.
docblock.long-description: This is to catch errors that are not normally caught by the error handler, such as E_PARSE.

docblock.description: Retrieves the config settings for the exception type, and cascades down to the _default settings if there is nothing relavant to the type.
Renders an error with a view file.
docblock.long-description: The view library is not used because there is a chance that it will fail within this context. Include the exception HTML cascading system /views/errors/ 1. $view 2. error type - folder and error code - php file 3. error type - php file 4. error code - php file

docblock.description: Performs the logging is enabled
Sends the email if enabled
Performs the action set in configuration
Redirects the user upon error
Displays the error
Performs a callback on the error before displaying
CatchAll for actions.
docblock.long-description: Just displays the error.

docblock.description: This is a demo callback that serves an example for how to use the callback action type.

docblock.description: jsmin.php - PHP implementation of Douglas Crockford's JSMin.
docblock.long-description:
This is pretty much a direct port of jsmin.c to PHP with just a few PHP-specific performance tweaks. Also, whereas jsmin.c reads from stdin and outputs to stdout, this library accepts a string as input and returns another string as output.

PHP 5 or higher is required.

Permission is hereby granted to use this version of the library under the same terms as jsmin.c, which has the following license:

-- Copyright (c) 2002 Douglas Crockford (www.crockford.com)

Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:

The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all copies or substantial portions of the Software.

The Software shall be used for Good, not Evil.

THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM, OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE

SOFTWARE.
